name: MENS POLO VIETNAM VETERAN & ARMY TAB- PSBP25/A
description:
A Vietnam veteran is someone who served in the armed forces of participating countries during the Vietnam War.
The term has been used to describe veterans who were in the armed forces of South Vietnam, the United States armed forces, and countries allied to them, whether or not they were actually stationed in Vietnam during their service. However, the more common usage distinguishes between those who served "in country" and those who did not actually serve in Vietnam by referring to the "in country" veterans as "Vietnam veterans" and the others as "Vietnam era veterans". The U.S. government officially refers to all as "Vietnam era veterans"

name: MENS POLO PURPLE HEART & ARMY TAB- PSBP24/A
description: The Purple Heart is a United States military decoration awarded in the name of the President to those who have been wounded or killed while serving on or after April 5, 1917 with the U.S. military. With its forerunner, the Badge of Military Merit, which took the form of a heart made of purple cloth, the Purple Heart is the oldest award that is still given to members of the U.S. military, the only earlier award being the obsolete Fidelity Medallion. The National Purple Heart Hall of Honor is located in New Windsor, New York.

name: HONOR CORDZ BLUE STAR FAMILY - HCBBlueStarFamily
description:
WE - HONOR - YOU

Description

HONOR CORDZ are made in the USA with Genuine Issue Military Spec Stainless Steel Dog Tags and Officially Licensed Pins.

The Paracord Bracelets are made in the USA with 550 paracord. US Military issue paracord Type III rated with a minimum breaking strength of 550 pounds, thus the sobriquet "550 cord".

The process of attaching an insignia cloisonné or enamel pin has been a mastered process over the last 25 years by Steve Ehrlich founder of Command Headquarters Military Designs and is GUARANTEED to not come off. 

After finding a Paracord manufacturer in the USA that put that same craftsmanship and durability as the tags, he was now ready to produce HONOR CORDZ.

HONOR CORDZ were created to show tribute or HONOR to our Armed Forces. If something you’re looking to show HONOR to doesn’t have a pin HONOR CORDZ can design a custom pin and have it manufactured for you!

The HONOR CORDZ motto is:

WE - HONOR - YOU

Every HONOR CORDZ bracelet is made to order. Please allow 7-10 business days to receive order.

HONOR CORDZ are made in the USA with Genuine Issue Military Spec Stainless Steel Dog Tags and Officially Licensed Pins.

The Paracord Bracelets are made in the USA with 550 paracord. US Military issue paracord Type III rated with a minimum breaking strength of 550 pounds, thus the sobriquet "550 cord".

The process of attaching an insignia cloisonné or enamel pin has been a mastered process over the last 25 years by Steve Ehrlich founder of Command Headquarters Military Designs and is GUARANTEED to not come off. 

After finding a Paracord manufacturer in the USA that put that same craftsmanship and durability as the tags, he was now ready to produce HONOR CORDZ.

HONOR CORDZ were created to show tribute or HONOR to our Armed Forces. If something you’re looking to show HONOR to doesn’t have a pin HONOR CORDZ can design a custom pin and have it manufactured for you!

The HONOR CORDZ motto is:

WE - HONOR - YOU

Every HONOR CORDZ bracelet is made to order. Please allow 7-10 business days to receive order.

name: POW MIA Black Dog Tag w/ Vietnam Service Ribbon
description:
POW MIA Dog Tag w/ Vietnam Service Ribbon

Genuine military spec black or stainless steel dog tag with a POW MIA pin attached. 

Because of the large number of POW's and MIA's during the Vietnam war, we enhanced this world recognizable symbol with  the Vietnam service ribbon. 

EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS.

name: Brothers Forever [ Shirt ]
description:
Brothers Forever

I would say that this is probably my most sought after design.  

Not only because it unites all Vietnam Veterans as Brothers, but also because it has all of the elements that you would have encountered during your "stay" in Vietnam.  

Helicopters flank both sides of the design. The palm trees, and of course the word veteran in barbed wire.  

The vibrant colors make this design stand out on any color shirt and should certainly be included in your collection of Vietnam t-shirts!

We even have a matching patch and window decal! Take a look on our other pages.

Vietnam veteran is a phrase used to describe someone who served in the armed forces of participating countries during the Vietnam War.

The term has been used to describe veterans who were in the armed forces of South Vietnam, the United States armed forces, and countries allied to them, whether or not they were actually stationed in Vietnam during their service.

However, the more common usage distinguishes between those who served "in country" and those who did not actually serve in Vietnam by referring to the "in country" veterans as "Vietnam veterans" and the others as "Vietnam era veterans". The U.S. government officially refers to all as "Vietnam era veterans".

name: Stainless Dog Tag w/ Vietnam Service Ribbon above POW MIA Shield
description:
Some Gave All over POW Shield

Stainless Dog Tag w/ Vietnam Service Ribbon above POW MIA Shield

Genuine military spec stainless steel dog tag with a POW MIA pin attached.

Because of the large number of POW's and MIA's during the Vietnam war, we enhanced this world recognizable symbol with the Vietnam service ribbon.

ALL DESIGNS ARE EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: POW MIA DOG TAGS
description:
POW MIA DOG TAGS

When I designed this shirt no one ever thought of the Persian Gulf, Afghanistan, or Iraq as war zones.  

At the time, the numbers that appear for POW MIA was current with the POW MIA registry in Washington. 

Who knew?? Each branch logo surrounds the then up to and including current #'s.

ALL DESIGNS ARE EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: POW MIA COLLAGE
description:
POW MIA COLLAGE  

Barbed wire in the shape of the POW shield surround a Vietnam Service Award. 

The medallion shows a squad coming out of the boonies and in the background are 3 POW's looking as though they are in a tiger cage. 

A Purple Heart award is on the left side and a cross with dog tags hanging off of it and a POW shield at its base balances out the design on the right side. 

The platoon is standing on the medallion of the Vietnam Campaign ribbon.


ALL DESIGNS ARE EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: PLEASE HEAR THIER CRIES
description:
PLEASE HEAR THIER CRIES  

This was my very first POW MIA design that was introduced in 1992. 

Below the large text POW MIA in a semi circle are all of the branches of the military and including US civilial hostages.  

The wrists are bound with bamboo ties that turn into "Please Hear Thier Cries" and encircle the POW shield. 

As Desert Storm was just over, I included it in the shield.  

My message was very clear "WE MUST NEVER FORGET"


ALL DESIGNS ARE EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: POW MIA Barbed Wire
description:
POW MIA  

This is the same design as "MISSING" except with the text POW MIA.  

Both are in full color and we even have a large back patch to match this one. 

If you wear or collect POW MIA shirts, this is your chance
to purchase designs that were only available at veteran reunions.

ALL DESIGNS ARE EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: MISSING
description:
MISSING 

This preceded the same design only with POW MIA in it. 

Through the years I have seen very few shirts honoring the Missing.  

Here is a perfect opportunity to say Thank You for your service and sacrifice.

ALL DESIGNS ARE EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: PTSD - The Darkest Side of Dark [shirt]
description:
PTSD - The Darkest Side of Dark

We also have a matching patch.

Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) is a severe anxiety disorder that can develop after exposure to any event that results in psychological trauma.

This event may involve the threat of death to oneself or to someone else, or to one's own or someone else's physical, sexual, or psychological integrity, overwhelming the individual's ability to cope.

As an effect of psychological trauma, PTSD is less frequent and more enduring than the more commonly seen acute stress response.

Diagnostic symptoms for PTSD include re-experiencing the original trauma(s) through flashbacks or nightmares, avoidance of stimuli associated with the trauma, and increased arousal—such as difficulty falling or staying asleep, anger, and hyper-vigilance.

Formal diagnostic criteria (both DSM-IV-TR and ICD-10) require that the symptoms last more than one month and cause significant impairment in social, occupational, or other important areas of functioning.

PTSD Veteran Support Services: 
http://www.va.gov/ 
http://www.ptsd.va.gov/ 
http://ptsdsupport.net/ 
http://www.1800vahelpline.com/

Dept. of Veterans Affairs Hotline, Staffed 24/7 with Mental Health professionals who can refer callers to one of more than 120 VA crisis centers closest to them.

Their goal is to get the veteran the best immediate help needed: 800-273-8255. Spanish speaking line is 888-628-9454.

THIS DESIGN IS EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: Proud Lady of a Vietnam Veteran
description:
Proud Lady of a Vietnam Veteran

THIS DESIGN IS EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: Proud Wife of a Vietnam Veteran
description:
Proud Wife of a Vietnam Veteran

THIS DESIGN IS EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: FIREBASE DRAGON
description:
FIREBASE DRAGON

One of my most popular earlier dragon designs this is in vibrant service ribbon colors.  

1960-  is on one side and Vietnam is on the other side.  

The center ribbon is for your firebase.  We have over 75 provinces, villages, and towns, but there are a few I may have missed, so give 2 or 3 locals.

Please email us [ support@chqusa.com ] your firebase and we will add it to the center of the shirt for free.

ALL DESIGNS ARE EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: POW MIA Sheild
description:
POW MIA Shield
 
A prisoner of war is a person, whether civilian or combatant, who is held in custody by an enemy power during or immediately after an armed conflict.

The earliest recorded usage of the phrase is dated 1660.

Missing in action (MIA) is a casualty Category assigned under the Status of Missing to armed services personnel who are reported missing during active service.

They may have been killed, wounded, become a prisoner of war, or deserted.

If deceased, neither their remains nor grave can be positively identified.

Becoming MIA has been an occupational risk for service personnel for as long as there has been warfare.

THIS DESIGN IS EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: FREEDOM WE FOUGHT FOR IT
description:
FREEDOM WE FOUGHT FOR IT  

Another of my earlier designs I liked it so much, I had it tattooed in color on my left arm.

ALL DESIGNS ARE EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: Welcome Home
description:
WELCOME HOME  

This was actually my first Vietnam Veteran design. 

As I didn't want to offend anyone by using or not using their loved ones name, I put the name George I. Jones on the bracelet and the capture date as 1-21.  

George I. Jones is better know as G.I.Joe and 1-21 is my birthday. 

The term WELCOME HOME was  really established after Vietnam. 

Because  public opinion was so low about the Vietnam Veteran, the phrase WELCOME HOME BROTHER from one vet to another became very significant because it reassured the returning vet that there was someone who really cared. 

Today, it is a way of showing honor and respect to each other.  We always say to any vet, "WELCOME HOME BROTHER"

ALL DESIGNS ARE EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: Back From Hell to Raise Hell
description:
Back From Hell to Raise Hell

Vietnam Era Design

Excellent shirt to have under any Biker Vest!

Vietnam: officially the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is the easternmost country on the Indochina Peninsula in Southeast Asia.

It is bordered by China to the north, Laos to the northwest, Cambodia to the southwest, and the South China Sea – referred to in Vietnam as the East Sea to the east.

With an estimated 90.5 million inhabitants as of 2011, Vietnam is the world's 13th-most-populous country, and the eighth-most-populous Asian country.

The Vietnamese became independent from Imperial China in 938 AD, following the Battle of Bạch Đằng River.

Successive Vietnamese royal dynasties flourished as the nation expanded geographically and politically into Southeast Asia, until the Indochina Peninsula was colonized by the French in the mid-19th century.

Efforts to resist the French eventually led to their expulsion from the country in the mid-20th century, leaving Vietnam divided politically into two countries.

Fighting between the two sides continued, with heavy foreign intervention, during the Vietnam War, which ended with a North Vietnamese victory in 1975.

THIS DESIGN IS EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: It's Not Easy Being Green
description:
It's Not Easy Being Green

The vibrant colors make this design stand out and should certainly be included in your collection.

The United States Navy's Sea, Air, and Land Teams, commonly known as Navy SEALs, are the U.S. Navy's principal special operations force and a part of the Naval Special Warfare Command (NSWC) as well as the maritime component of the United States Special Operations Command.

The acronym is derived from their capacity to operate at sea, in the air, and on land. 

In the War on Terror, SEALs have been utilized almost exclusively for land-based operations, including Direct Action, Hostage Rescue, Counter Terrorism, Special Reconnaissance, unconventional warfare and foreign internal defense operations. 

SEAL Teams

SEAL Teams are organized into two groups: 
Naval Special Warfare Group One (West Coast), and Naval Special Warfare Group Two (East Coast), which come under the command of Naval Special Warfare Command, stationed at NAB Coronado, California. 

As of 2006, there are eight confirmed Navy SEAL Teams. 

The original SEAL Teams in the Vietnam War were separated between West Coast (Team ONE) and East Coast (Team TWO) SEALs. 

The current SEAL Team deployments include Teams 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, and 10.

name: VIETNAM, THE LAND GOD FORGOT
description:
VIETNAM, THE LAND GOD FORGOT  

During your tour or maybe two or three, there were many things that you may have picked up along the way. PTSD, AGENT ORANGE, a CIB, CAR, a PURPLE HEART are just a few listed on the shirt.  

And if there is one there that you didn't get, be sure that your buddy did. This is just a gentle reminder of your wonderful adventures in paradise. 

ALL DESIGNS ARE EXCLUSIVE PROPERTY OF COMMAND HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DESIGNS.

name: All Wars POW MIA T-Shirt
description:
All Wars POW MIA

This patch pays honor to all POW and MIA's from every war.

The design shows that we believe and that they are not forgotten.

The vibrant colors make this design stand out on any color shirt and should certainly be included in your collection.

We also have a matching patch.

A prisoner of war is a person, whether civilian or combatant, who is held in custody by an enemy power during or immediately after an armed conflict. 

The earliest recorded usage of the phrase is dated 1660.

Missing in action (MIA) is a casualty Category assigned under the Status of Missing to armed services personnel who are reported missing during active service. 

They may have been killed, wounded, become a prisoner of war, or deserted. 

If deceased, neither their remains nor grave can be positively identified. 

Becoming MIA has been an occupational risk for service personnel for as long as there has been warfare.

name: Not as Lean, Not as Mean, But Still a Marine
description:
Not as Lean, Not as Mean, But Still a Marine  

All you marines, and you know who you are, always brag about your military heritage.  Well here you go.

The vibrant colors make this design stand out on any color shirt and should certainly be included in your collection. 

The United States Marine Corps (USMC) is currently the largest marine force in the world, responsible for much of the United States expeditionary operations. 

Created in 1775, they were originally intended only to guard naval vessels during the American Revolutionary War.[20] 

While the USMC is a component part of the Department of the Navy in the military command structure, it is a military branch separate from the United States Navy. 

The USMC also provides Marines as security guards at U.S. diplomatic posts throughout the world. They also provide helicopter transportation for the President of the United States aboard Marine 1. 

USMC motto is Semper Fidelis, "always faithful".

name: POW Medicine Wheel
description:
Pow Medicine Wheel  

This design pays honor to POW MIA's from Korea, Vietnam, and Iraq. 

The red, white, and blue feathers are of course the American flag.  

The  feathers at the bottom are the colors of the  service ribbons for the 3 wars mentioned. 

The vibrant colors make this design stand out on any color shirt and should certainly be included in your collection of Vietnam t-shirts!

Vietnam veteran is a phrase used to describe someone who served in the armed forces of participating countries during the Vietnam War.

The term has been used to describe veterans who were in the armed forces of South Vietnam, the United States armed forces, and countries allied to them, whether or not they were actually stationed in Vietnam during their service.

However, the more common usage distinguishes between those who served "in country" and those who did not actually serve in Vietnam by referring to the "in country" veterans as "Vietnam veterans" and the others as "Vietnam era veterans". The U.S. government officially refers to all as "Vietnam era veterans".

name: Feathers Vietnam Veteran
description:
Feathers Vietnam Veteran

The feathers around the design are the colors of the Vietnam service ribbon.  

Of course the do rag is the american flag adorning the head of our national symbol.  

Look in the eagles eye and see the pow silhouette. 

This was, and still is one the most  popular Vietnam veteran designs in my collection.  

We even have a matching patch and window decal! Take a look on our other pages.

Vietnam veteran is a phrase used to describe someone who served in the armed forces of participating countries during the Vietnam War.

The term has been used to describe veterans who were in the armed forces of South Vietnam, the United States armed forces, and countries allied to them, whether or not they were actually stationed in Vietnam during their service. 

However, the more common usage distinguishes between those who served "in country" and those who did not actually serve in Vietnam by referring to the "in country" veterans as "Vietnam veterans" and the others as "Vietnam era veterans". The U.S. government officially refers to all as "Vietnam era veterans".

name: 173rd Airborne Brigade Sky Soldier
description:
173rd Airborne Brigade Sky Soldier

Hey Sky soldier.  Are you looking for the shirt that makes you feel like you just pulled the rip cord?  Well look no further.  

If the lighting bolts don't catch you eye, the Sky Soldier or Herd names will certainly let all who see you in it let them know who you are. 

Shown here with the Vietnam service ribbon.  What's that you say. You're a lot younger and didn't serve in Vietnam.  

Just make sure you let us know and we will take it out.  

Unfortunately I only have a small ribbon for Iraq.  

Vibrant colors make this a standout on any color shirt.

Activated in 1915, as the 173rd Infantry Brigade, the unit saw service in World War I, but is best known for its actions during the Vietnam War. 

The brigade was the first major United States Army ground formation deployed in Vietnam, serving there May 1965–1971 and losing almost 1,800 soldiers. 

Noted for its roles in Operation Hump and Operation Junction City, the 173rd is best known for the Battle of Dak To, where it suffered heavy casualties in close combat with North Vietnamese forces. 

Brigade members received over 7,700 decorations, including more than 6,000 Purple Hearts. The brigade returned to the United States, where it was deactivated in 1972.

MIA

All Veterans

This design would make an excellent addition to your collection or even better on a vest, jacket, shirt, or hat!

These patches have a heat seal backing that can be pressed onto most fabrics with a heat transfer machine.
